title: Quantitative Researcher 2026
description:
We are looking for Quantitative Researchers to help us build models, strategies, and systems that price and trade financial instruments. You’ll work side by side with experienced researchers who are committed to teaching, guiding, and supporting our newest hires, learning how we think about experiment design, dataset generation, time series analysis, feature engineering, and model building for financial datasets.
At Jane Street, our researchers, engineers, and traders sit a few feet away from each other and work together to train models, architect systems, and run trading strategies. We work with petabytes of data, a computing cluster with hundreds of thousands of cores, and a growing GPU cluster containing thousands of high-end GPUs. Depending on the day, we might be diving deep into market data, tuning hyperparameters, debugging distributed training performance, or studying how our model likes to trade in production.
We don’t believe in “one-size-fits-all” modeling solutions; we are open to and excited about applying all different types of statistical and ML techniques, from linear models to deep learning, depending on what best fits a given problem. The most successful researchers will be driven by a curiosity for how their contributions fit into the larger picture of our trading operations, and how to adapt their findings into actionable strategies.
About you
If you’ve never thought about a career in finance, you’re in good company. Many of us were in the same position before working here. If you have a curious mind and a passion for solving interesting problems, we have a feeling you’ll fit right in. You should be:
Able to apply logical and mathematical thinking to all kinds of problems
Intellectually curious; eager to ask questions, admit mistakes, and learn new things 
A strong programmer who’s comfortable with Python
An open-minded thinker and precise communicator who enjoys collaborating with colleagues from a wide range of backgrounds and areas of expertise
Fluent in English
Most candidates will have experience with data science or machine learning, but ultimately, we’re more interested in how you think and learn, than what you currently know. PhD or other research experience is a plus.
essential_requirements: Ability to apply logical and mathematical thinking to problems
Experience with data science or machine learning (most candidates)
Familiarity with time series analysis, feature engineering, and model building for financial datasets (or demonstrated ability to learn these)
Intellectual curiosity and eagerness to learn/admit mistakes
Excellent communication skills and ability to collaborate across disciplines
preferred_requirements: PhD or other formal research experience
Experience working with large-scale datasets (petabyte-scale) and high-performance compute clusters
Experience with GPU-based training and tuning deep learning models
Experience with distributed training and debugging distributed training performance
Practical experience applying ML/statistical techniques to finance or trading
Experience mentoring or teaching junior researchers/hires
hard_skills: Working with large-scale data and high-performance compute resources
soft_skills: Collaboration and teamwork across researchers, engineers, and traders
Adaptability and practical focus on actionable results
key_responsibilities: Design, build and validate models, strategies and systems to price and trade financial instruments (including feature engineering and time series modeling).
Collaborate closely with researchers, engineers, and traders to train models, tune hyperparameters, debug distributed training and integrate models into production trading systems.
Lead experiment design and dataset generation, analyze results, and translate research findings into actionable trading strategies and operational improvements.
tools_and_technologies: Deep learning frameworks (e.g., PyTorch, TensorFlow) for model development
Distributed training frameworks and orchestration (e.g., Horovod, Ray, Kubernetes, Slurm - likely)
High-performance compute clusters and GPU clusters (thousands of GPUs)
Big-data tooling / processing frameworks (e.g., Spark, Dask — likely) and large-scale data storage
Version control (Git) and experiment tracking (e.g., MLflow, Weights & Biases - recommended)
Monitoring and production tooling for model behavior and trading systems
company_values: Collaborative, cross-disciplinary teamwork (researchers, engineers, traders working together)
Teaching, mentorship and investment in newcomer development
Practical focus on translating research into actionable trading outcomes
Precision in communication and admitting/learning from mistakes
tailoring_recommendations: Lead with Python and ML expertise on your CV; list concrete projects using time series, feature engineering, and model building.
Highlight experience with large-scale data, HPC/GPU usage, distributed training, and any tooling you used (name frameworks and cluster sizes if possible).
If you have a PhD or research publications, put them prominently; describe research methods and experimental design.
Show collaboration examples: working with engineers/traders, mentoring juniors, or cross-functional projects.
Quantify impact: include metrics (e.g., model performance improvements, latency, data volumes, cores/GPUs used, production outcomes).
Include relevant ATS keywords from the job description naturally in role summaries and skills section.
Provide links to code/repos, papers, or runnable demos that demonstrate your modeling and engineering ability.
Emphasize curiosity and learning: brief examples where you learned a new technique, admitted mistakes, and iterated to improvement.
